text: Lalande 21185 is the largest red dwarf ever discovered with a diameter of , It is located in the constellation of Ursa Major. Although relatively close by, it's visual magnitude is only 7 in visible light and thus is too dim to see with the naked eye. The star is visible through a small telescope.Sherrod, P. Clay & Koed, Thomas L. 2003. A complete manual of amateur astronomy: tools and techniques for astronomical observations. Courier Dover, p9. At about away this star is the fifth closest stellar system to the Sun; only the Alpha Centauri system, Barnard's Star, WISE 1049-5319 and Wolf 359 are closer. Because of its proximity it is a frequent subject for astronomical surveys and other research. It is known by other designations, such as BD+36 2147, Gliese 411, and HD 95735. == References == Category:Red dwarfs
title: Lalande 21185
